newsitem.title: USA: Duff & Phelps may upgrade Grand Met debt.
newsitem.headline: Duff & Phelps may upgrade Grand Met debt.

text.p: Duff & Phelps Credit Rating Co said Monday it may upgrade Grand Metropolitan Plc's Eurobonds, debentures, notes, preferred stock and commercial paper following the company's announcment it will merge with Guinness Plc and make a capital repayment.

Duff & Phelps currently rates the company's Eurobonds, debentures and notes as Single-A, its preferred stock as Single-A-Minus and its commercial paper as D-One. Duff & Phelps said it put the ratings on "Ratings Watch-Up", a move that covers about 4.4 billion pounds of debt and preferred stock.
Britain's Guinness and Grand Met said on Monday they would merge to form a new company called GMG Brands. The combined group was valued at more than 20 billion pounds on Friday's share price.
The deal includes a capital repayment to shareholders of not less than 60 pence per share, worth about 2.4 billion pounds.
GMG Brands will generate considerable cash flow, Duff & Phelps said, with pro forma profit before interest and taxes of 2.2 billion pounds.

"Grand Met's ratings will remain on Rating Watch-Up until DCR can assess management's financial and operational strategy and make a final determination of the combined entity's capital structure," Duff & Phelps said.
